title: Looking for a nice font...
content: I am beginning a web site project for a lady who sells realty. I have decided to use simply her name with a nice serif font for the logo. Any ideas on some fonts that might work well? Should I go with more of a san serif? Thank You!
author: zolli

comments.content: What is a lady who sells realty?
I am going to assume thats a real question: They call them Estate Agents in the UK. They sell your house for a fee.

Oh, un'agente immobilare, grazie.   
Real Estate is a real Summer here.   
I don't know how about the font, Mr. Shaun Pansolli ,   
Since we live in buildings and our ideas in the letters,   
I guess there are several ways to approach that business,   
as there are many foundries.
Alessandro, it is a lady who sells immobili.
Of course. And drives a flashy convertible. It's show biz.
Then I advice you to shoot the serif and pick up these sans legs. ![Bryant Leg](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516051325im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/36179.jpg)

Alessandro, how did you embed that image? It's the only time an image has come through in my email app (NS4.72), so I didn't have to go to the actual Typophile page to see it.   
   
hhp
What do you mean sans? There's clearly a serif there, pointing toward the window!

I first embedded the legs but I don't know Hrant, really!   
Sorry Mr. Shaun Pansolli, I change my mind,   
here Mr. Steve Peter is  right!
It does look like a leg-itimate serif

Your observation is really subtle Mr. Chris Lozos,   
I found a specimen of a leg-itimate sans/   
Hope that helps.   
   
 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20050516051325im_/http:/www.typophile.com/forums/messages/30/36208.jpg)
Che bella, The curves meet quite gracefully in the decenders
